page.title: 10Ryders Farm - horses
page.content: I love on{Ryders Farm.}Originally there were three fields with the farm. Two were sold to a farmer from Preston for his{beef cattle.}We had one field and split it into two. There is a{barn and old{stables.}Near the old stables we built some new ones. We{ploughed the field and put fencing along the boundary. In winter the farmer takes his cattle to his farm near Preston. Our farm has{19 horses stabled}on it. It is Â£6 a week for the use of the field and stabling. I have a horse at our farm which I got for Christmas. All around our farm are fields and {Clifton Moss.}There are other farms: {Unity Brook Farm, Clifton Moss Farm, {Clifton House Farm.}They all{rent out {stables and fields.}In winter you have to buy hay, straw and horse food. It costs about Â£16 a week, in total,to keep a horse in winter.
